page.title: 09Public Transport
page.content: Public Transport in Cranbrook consists of buses.The nearsest railway station is at Staplehurst,five miles away.this runs from Pluckley to Charring Cross in London.There are two state run bus routes in the Maidstone and district area.The main one runs between Gillingham and Hastings.It goes via Chatham,Maidstone,Cranbrook,Hawkhurst and Battle.It is almost an hourly service.The other route goes from Tunbridge wells to Tenterden.The service goes via Pembury,Matfield, Goudhurst and Cranbrook.It is an hourly service.There is also a private service called Fuggles running from Benenden.It links up the villages to big towns e.g Croyden and eastbourne.They have 18 routes each of which only runs one bus once a week.Travel is expensive,rural services have declined in recent years.
